properties.title: How to use the SBB WebService
properties.author: Franz Maier

section.p: To use the SBB WebService on the mobile device, first deploy the SBB midlet on the mobile device as described in How to setup the mobile device.
By touching the shortcut on the screen you can start the SBB Midlet. After launching the application you get an input screen where you can type in your search criteria.

The main menu contains the menu items "Send", "Result", "Configuration", "Log" and "Exit". To search for a certain connection you have to type in the departure station and the station where to arrive, as well as the date and time, when to travel. Click the "Send" button to request a connection for the given data.

An alert will show that the request was successfully forwarded to the next proxy. By clicking "OK" you will get back to the initial window where you put in the data. Click the "Result" button and you get either a selection for ambiguous stations you typed in or a list with 4 connections is shown on the screen.
If the result shows a list with a selection for different stations, you have to choose a unique station and send the request again.
When a list with 4 connections is displayed on the screen, you can choose one of them and click the "send" button again.
The result will show the details for one connection, i.e. the departure station, the station to arrive, the departure and arrival time, the platforms, a travel with description and a comment.
If you go back to the result list with 4 connections shown on the display, you can either save this connections by clicking the save button (not yet implemented) or go back to the initial query form.

The main menu associated with the initial window contains two other possibilities for interaction: You can select the "Log" menu item and you will see the output generated by the logger of the application. if you select "Configuration" a window with copyright info will be displayed and you additionally have the possibility to choose a connection type, either HTTP or BT (at the moment only BT is implemented).
